pddl4j.exp
Class ListExp

java.lang.Object
  pddl4j.exp.AbstractExp
      pddl4j.exp.ListExp
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Exp>, Exp
Direct Known Subclasses:
AndExp, OrExp
public abstract class ListExp
extends AbstractExp
implements java.lang.Iterable<Exp>

This abstract class implements the common part of the conjunctive and disjunctive expression of the PDDL language.

See Also:
Serialized Form

standardize

public ListExp standardize(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> images)
Standardizes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression. The map argument is used to store the variable already standardized. Remember that free variables are existentially quantified.

Specified by:
standardize in interface Exp
Parameters:
images - the object that maps old variable images to the standardize image.
Returns:
a standardized copy of this expression.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if images == null.
See Also:
Exp.standardize(Map)

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
